intro: Ctenitis vogelii, commonly known as the Vogel's tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its fronds are typically bright green and can be quite broad, contributing to its ornamental value. Ctenitis vogelii is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
